input: question: How many lions are found on the Golden Boot? [SEP] sentence: Two of the lions are found above the handles on either side of the trophy – the third is symbolised by the captain of the title winning team as he raises the trophy, and its gold crown, above his head at the end of the season.

question: Who have studies of the mtDNA of Turkic-speaking peoples shown they're closest to genetically? [SEP] sentence: Genetic studies of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) of Amerindians and some Siberian and Central Asian peoples also revealed that the gene pool of the Turkic-speaking peoples of Siberia such as Altaians, Khakas, Shors and Soyots, living between the Altai and Lake Baikal along the Sayan mountains, are genetically closest to Amerindians.[citation needed]

question: What is the main example of a DC power source? [SEP] sentence: Found in applications as diverse as industrial fans, blowers and pumps, machine tools, household appliances, power tools, and disk drives, electric motors can be powered by direct current (DC) sources, such as from batteries, motor vehicles or rectifiers, or by alternating current (AC) sources, such as from the power grid, inverters or generators.
question: Where did a coup take place? [SEP] sentence: Independence was unilaterally declared on 24 September 1973.

question: What dynasty consisted of descendants of Charles Martel? [SEP] sentence: Pippin's takeover was reinforced with propaganda that portrayed the Merovingians as inept or cruel rulers, exalted the accomplishments of Charles Martel, and circulated stories of the family's great piety.
question: How many people were gravely injured by the derailment? [SEP] sentence: 43 people were killed and more than ten were seriously injured.

question: Which group is heavily responsible for passive air defence? [SEP] sentence: Passive air defence is defined by NATO as "Passive measures taken for the physical defence and protection of personnel, essential installations and equipment in order to minimize the effectiveness of air and/or missile attack".

question: What is Susan Prager communication director of? [SEP] sentence: The outreach director of HRTR, Susan Prager, is also the communication director of "Friends of Falun Gong", a quasi-government non-profit funded by fmr.

question: What amount of conventional pesticide use does the agricultural sector account for? [SEP] sentence: As of 2007, there were more than 1,055 active ingredients registered as pesticides, which yield over 20,000 pesticide products that are marketed in the United States.

question: What type of work did Paul Vi finish that had been started by two previous popes? [SEP] sentence: In doing so, Paul VI saw himself following in the footsteps of the Apostle Paul, torn to several directions as Saint Paul, who said, "I am attracted to two sides at once, because the Cross always divides."

question: What is the oldest resident professional theater company in Oklahoma? [SEP] sentence: Prominent theatre companies in Oklahoma include, in the capital city, Oklahoma City Theatre Company, Carpenter Square Theatre, Oklahoma Shakespeare in the Park, and CityRep.

question: When was the central body of the Grand Orient de France reconstituted? [SEP] sentence: His successor, the Duke of Orléans, reconstituted the central body as the Grand Orient de France in 1773.
question: What is the criteria for copyright? [SEP] sentence: Scientific and critical editions can be protected by copyright as works of authorship if enough creativity/originality is provided.

question: ICBMs is an abbreviation for what? [SEP] sentence: Given this new danger, the United States participated in an arms race with the Soviet Union that included development of the hydrogen bomb, as well as intercontinental strategic bombers and intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs) capable of delivering nuclear weapons.

question: What did Chaucer call the area in 1391? [SEP] sentence: Aristotle wrote in his book Meteorology about an Antarctic region in c. 350 B.C. Marinus of Tyre reportedly used the name in his unpreserved world map from the 2nd century A.D.

question: How many additional leisure venues are run by Council executives? [SEP] sentence: With the addition of 11 other additional leisure venures which are currently operate by the Council leisure executives.
